intro: Pentagonia bocataurensis, commonly known as the golden pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique beauty and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
